Two simultaneous requests for the same brail view that has not yet been compiled cause the following exception:
Exception information: Exception type: System.NullReferenceException Exception message: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
Request information: Request URL: http://.../login/Authenticate.bam Request path: /login/Authenticate.bam User host address: 192.168.1.32 User: Is authenticated: False Authentication Type: Thread account name: LOCKE\IWAM_LOCKE
Thread information: Thread ID: 5 Thread account name: LOCKE\IWAM_LOCKE Is impersonating: False Stack trace: at Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.CreateBrailBase(IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller, TextWriter output, Type type) at Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.GetCompiledScriptInstance(String file, TextWriter output, IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller) at Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.GetOutput(TextWriter output, IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller) at Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.Process(TextWriter output, IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller, String templateName) at Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.Process(IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller, String templateName) at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Services.DefaultViewEngineManager.Process(IRailsEngineContext context, Controller controller, String templateName) at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.ControllerLifecycleExecutor.ProcessView() at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.ControllerLifecycleExecutor.ProcessSelectedAction(IDictionary actionArgs) at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.ControllerLifecycleExecutor.ProcessSelectedAction() at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.MonoRailHttpHandler.Process(IRailsEngineContext context) at Castle.MonoRail.Framework.MonoRailHttpHandler.ProcessRequest(HttpContext context) at System.Web.HttpApplication.CallHandlerExecutionStep.System.Web.HttpApplication.IExecutionStep.Execute() at System.Web.HttpApplication.ExecuteStep(IExecutionStep step, Boolean& completedSynchronously)
Here is my interpretion of what might be happening: 1. Thread A runs through line 391 in BooViewEngine.CompileScript, which adds the type to the compilations hashtable. (Line numbers are from the RC3 tag.) 2. Thread B starts running. In BooViewEngine.GetCompiledScriptInstance, lines 319 and 322, it finds that a type has been added to the compilations hashtable for the given filename. 3. Thread B enters CreateBrailBase and fetches a null reference from the constructors hashtable, because Thread A has not had a chance to set a value in it yet. It then throws an exception on the constructor.Invoke call (line 346).
I am guessing this bug still exists in trunk; I took a peek at the relevant code and it didn't seem any different. I can't seem to reproduce this bug on the VS web server; maybe it handles the requests serially?
